greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows giving successive states of cellular automaton generated by "Rule 150" when started with a single ON cell.
comment: Also the coefficients of (x^2 + x + 1)^n mod 2. - _Alan DenAdel_, Mar 19 2014
The number of 0's in row n is A071052(n), and the number of 1's in row n is A071053(n). - _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2018
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; Chapter 3.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Elementary Cellular Automaton
S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
mathematica: T[ n_, k_] := T[n, k] = Which[k < 0 || k > 2 n, 0, n == k == 0, 1, True, Mod[ T[n - 1, k - 2] + T[n - 1, k - 1] + T[n - 1, k], 2]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2018 *)
program: (PARI) rown(n) = Vec(lift((x^2 + x + 1)^n * Mod(1, 2))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 20 2014
xref: This sequence, A038184 and A118110 are equivalent descriptions of the Rule 150 automaton.
results.author: _Hans Havermann_, May 26 2002
